titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Office of Development and Alumni Affairs, Yale University, "...and for Yale" Development Campaign Printed Materials and Memorabilia
Office of Development and Alumni Affairs, Yale University, "...and for Yale" Development Campaign Printed Materials and Memorabilia
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 09:17

did.unittitle: Office of Development and Alumni Affairs, Yale University, "...and for Yale" development campaign printed materials and memorabilia

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The materials consist of an invitation, a tie tack, a souvenir handkerchief, and a protest petition concerning the "...and for Yale" development campaign.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Yale University. Office of Development and Alumni Affairs

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 7-C (YRG 7-C), Records of Yale development projects and campaigns.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for materials authored or otherwise produced as official business of Yale University is retained by Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Office of Development and Alumni Affairs, Yale University, "...and for Yale" Development Campaign Printed Materials and Memorabilia (RU 826). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Yale University records are arranged and described at the accession level by the creating office. The University Archives creates collection level descriptive records, but typically does no further arrangement and description at the accession level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials consist of an invitation, a tie tack, a souvenir handkerchief, and a protest petition concerning the "...and for Yale" development campaign.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged by type of material.
